diff_hunk:
@@ -254,17 +254,26 @@
 - func: chunk(Tensor self, int64_t chunks, int64_t dim=0) -> TensorList
 
 - func: clamp(Tensor self, Scalar min, Scalar max) -> Tensor
+  python_default_init:
+    min: NAN
body:
NAN defined here (or any other non-empty input like 2) will generate a default 'None' in the function signature(for python_arg_parser usage) here, see [generation logic](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/tools/autograd/gen_python_functions.py#L729) here. It should not be a correct behavior for other default args when generating the signatures. Tracked the issue [here](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/9941) for records. As we will move away from python_default_init in the future, the logic will be automatically fixed after that. 

CC @zdevito
